intro: Nassauvia acerosa, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small, yellowish-orange, and arranged in dense clusters. Nassauvia acerosa is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
